data.title: Kids heaven
data.text: I take my grandkids here every time they visit.  The name should not be "Museum," as it is really a play house.  When kids enter they can run around without anyone telling them to stop.  There are kitchen areas, dress-up room, trains to build and play with, stories, puzzles, and even a scarf blow.  My grandkids are 3 and 7, and stayed 5 hours and still didn't want to go home!  Make sure you have time when you visit.  Adults must pay the small entrance fee also and stay with your kids. If you live in town, there is a great priced season ticket.

data.title: Rainy day fun
data.text: Great place to take young children! Everything from blocks to play with....to dress up and house to play in.

data.title: Mr. Bees reviews
data.text: Our visit to Main Street Children's Museum was great for the adults as well as kids.  It's a safe, clean, supervised play area for toddlers through second or third grade.  Our grandkids had loads of fun exploring the many things to do, physically as well as mentally.  We will return visit when our other granddaughter comes to visit.

data.title: Excellence educational resource for kids !
data.text: Excellent environment! Excellent staff! This Museum provides tactile,experiential opportunities for children 2 to 12. A wonderful magical wonderland of kids activities and a very colorful  environment.I know because I am  a stage designer and educator.... This is fun theater ! for both children and adults!!!

data.title: Great!
data.text: Our four year-old loves it! Plenty of stuff to do and play with and a very friendly staff. Also, as far as Children;s Museum's go it's pretty cheap and a great way to spend morning or afternoon.

data.title: Great for pre k kiddos
data.text: My daughter loved the museum especially the train table! Go early especially if there is a special event as this can get pretty crowded but even crowded it's worth it!

data.title: East Coast Gem: must DO with preschoolers
data.text: This is more than a children's museum, it's hands-on wonderment through the worlds created in children's books. It's dress-up in a princess costume and sail a pirate ship. There's opportunity for adults to interact or let them explore on their own, safety.  It's the perfect variety of activities and physical space for your young ones. I can't wait to take my grands back.

data.title: Fun with a four-year-old
data.text:
This small facility has plenty to do. With other young children around, lots of creativity came out, too.
However, although it is advertised for kids 3-6, a large group of apparently older kids came in for an hour or so midday. It was uncomfortable so we left, had lunch, and came back when they left.

data.title: It's like being a part of a book!
data.text: My 7 year old loves this place. It's like going to the biggest tree house filled with toys and games and more things to spark your imagination you can think of. It feels like you're in a story. We played dress up, read and had the best pretend meal ever.

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text: The building looks small, but for a child, this place is huge!  I love how using your imagination is encouraged and how there are staff members within the play area to help or to just play with the kids.  I also really like the story behind the museum. It is in an old bank.  How cool!!

data.title: Opens the imagination
data.text: This place is a tad small but definitely built to inspire your little ones imagination! My daughter gives this place  2 thumbs up. My only hesitation to give this place an excellent rating is the limited seating for adults and the fact you have to walk through their gift shop/toy area to get in. We could have done without that.

data.title: A Nice Adventure For Kids
data.text: I took my nephews here and they had a great time exploring the Children's Museum. There were enough activities to keep them occupied for several hours and we took a lot of fun pictures.

data.title: fun for small children, small building
data.text:
The museum is smaller than it looks, small shop up front and small play area for children.
it is right downtown, close to Fountain park and the fire museum

data.title: Your Children Will Cry .....
data.text: You read the title right!  They will cry ...when it's time to leave.  Lol.  Seriously though, this is a great place for the kids.  All the time, but especially on a rainy day or something.  Even I love the train station they have set up.  It's awesome!

data.title: Sparks creativity!
data.text:
I have taken my 2 1/2 grandson two weeks in a row to "the play place," and he loves it! First time, he made a bee line to the wooden track magnetic train table. The 6 foot? fairly round table has 2 cut outs that let little kids duck under and poke their heads up to reach the glued down tracks (some on trestles) in the middle of the table, He happily ducked back and forth between the inside and outside of the table for access to "his" trains.  

This last time he enjoyed the gauzy scarf squares that kids can hold over radiator vents and watch the float up in the air.  Their is also a "pirate" ship with gangway OR boarding rope ladder, ship's bell, captain's wheel, fake cannon. Stairs lead to a "tree" house with table, chairs, books. Downstairs another "Peter Pumpkin house" is for story reading, too. 

Well worth going. Better yet, join the Culture and Heritage Museum for a year, and have unlimited visits.

So far we've only gone for impulse visits, but they have a weekly story time for preschoolers, and I think art classes at times. Also will do birthday parties.

data.title: Perfect play site for small children
data.text: Our granddaughters - 1 and 3 years old - loved this place.  They did not want to leave.  Highly recommend.

data.title: Fun for the yong ones!
data.text: A great indoor play are for young children. A ship, dress up, kitchen play area, puppets, and so much more!

data.title: Great Place to Kill 2 hours with the kids!
data.text: Took my little boy here and we stayed for about 2hrs.  The place is very small but there is plenty to keep the kids occupied with.  The cost is also low for only $5 per person which i feel is very reasonable.  There is a big train set, a make shift house are, place for kids to play dress up and much more.  The only downside was the place was overstaffed and the staff hovered over everyone.  It actually got kind of annoying.  Best time to miss the rush is go around 11-12 and everyone is gone, early morning was busy even on a weekday.

data.title: From the Begining
data.text: I had the blessing to be involved with the Museum from the near the opening.  I was one of the first to hop with the frogs and I must say that everyone needs to bring their family especially the very young one for one of the best times of interactive fun that they can have.  Thanks Doc'

data.title: Great place for kids
data.text: This is a neat little play area for children and a place to let the parents take a break while the children play.
